workxp.title: Mentor at Udacity, Frontend, React, Cloud and Devops (AWS) Nanodegrees
text: Udacity is an online education platform which partners with companies like Google, Facebook, Github, Amazon and IBM to bring industry standard education programs to prepare candidates for the job market.
Reviewed thousands of projects consistently rating high on  performance metrics, review rating (>4.9/5), avg project review turnaround time (<1hour/8hours).
Resolved hundreds of issues on Javascript, React/Redux, AWS, helping students on their learning journey teaching the what, how and why.

Assessed degrees pre-launch, which involved catching bugs in projects, error in content and giving feedback on the student journey. At the moment(July, 2020), I am assessing Intermediate Javascript, Azure Cloud and Azure Devops Beta degrees. On launch I will be mentoring the degrees.

projects.title: Serverless Todo App
projects.text: A react todo app. The backend is deployed using Serverless and Cloudformation template. I used OAuth for authentication and DynamoDB for the database.Images are uploaded to S3 bucket with a presigned URL. Implemented warmup (reducing latency on cold start), request validation (reducing costs), canary deployment and xray. Please refer to readme for full functionality.

projects.title: Refactor Monolith to Microservices
projects.text: Refactored a monolith into microservices by leveraging docker containers and kubernetes cluster. The backend is seperated into 2 services, served by a reverseproxy at the same port. Each service can scale independently through replica sets.

projects.title: Would you Rather
projects.text: Implemented 'would you rather game' in react/redux. I used this project to learn redux and react-redux by implementing the hooks api in React framework.

projects.title: Neighbourhood Project
projects.text: Leveraged Yelp API to pull information about pizzerias around Sydney using Google Maps as the canvas. You can change the search query and the results update. The location can be updated as well, the modularity exists, but I didnâ€™t add it to view. In order learn/try Vue, I have refactored the project to Vue.js from Knockout.js and used webpack to bundle it.

projects.title: Interactive Resume
projects.text: This CV was made using Svelte. I modularized each section and separated the css from svelte components, so css can be edited individually. I used the opportunity to update my cv to learn some Svelte.
